page.title: 06Kinmount House-1
page.content:
This beautiful house in the style of {Georgian Scotland}is now little better than a worn out wreck.
The house,built on the site of old Kelhead House burnt down in 1800,was ordered to be built by the{6th Marquis {of Queensberry}and was finished in 1812.When it was built it was set in large majestic grounds which now sadly do not belong to the house but belong to the{Hoddam and Kinmount Estate.}The modern house is now only set in 13 acres of land with wrecked gardens, jungle lawns and cracked paving stones.It also has belonging to it 2 man-made lakes.
Round these lakes there is a large over grown bird reserve with Heron and Canada Geese being among the more unusual visitors.
